posts.content: Can anyone help with the model of Devon interior please

Well it is Devon esque. ..LHD converted.. A BITZA
bits from several models but with added pieces to make it
The easicool handle style is maybe later bay...
The drawer handles are 66 onwards...
The door cooker cuboard is 62 ish
The crockery cupboard is double door 64 ish with added handles matching the easicool..
The seat back is an interpretation. .with pull at bottom.
Ideally the seat back should be hinged at the bottom so it hinges down and lies on the base so you can get your feet to light to the division.

OK if you are 5' at 6' 3" I need the room..


But all very usable and very nice..
Only the nerds would know...
Cheers mate, I hoped you would pop up. Have you got any pictures of a genuine 63 Devon interior to compare please.

Well...is your bus LHD or Right hand drive?
I have pics of RHD...
The important feature is the cooker cupboard has the corner cut off..
Rippers bought the only genuine LHD interior that I know of...
If you are on PC search Rippers interior..
This was a 63MY...
Are you looking to buy a RHD or convert a RHD to LHD..
type21f wrote:Only the nerds would know...

One for the nerds? Righto...

MonkeyKnuts has a 62/63 interior search his build thread for reference pics.

Also search splitmaster on here and look at his last build thread. He has a mm correct replica of my 62/63 interior with lots of photos.

Your cooker cupboard is based on a 62 but is replica - look at the hinges which are replica pre-61 hinges. It has a later (67?) cooker in it too.

The sink unit is more bay or Canterbury Pitt esque - the metal round sink as opposed to the Devon plasticy one. The tap is a 63 tap.

The drawers look like they're based on a narrow hatch bus but with later plastic handles put in.

And as Graham says the bulkhead unit has been done with the bottom panel the 'wrong' way up so you can't use it for the extra leg room.

Overall a very nice looking job though, only the geeks would know!
The sink is an early bay one

What is the collective name for a group of nerds....

DEVON DICS

Thanks for all the help gents, much appreciated.

And the mild ....... taking!

Well I've bought it all as a job lot including all the interior cards.

Next is will it suit a dove blue bus, first thoughts are probably not but I might have to leave it as is until I can afford to have it reupholstered.

LOL..... you need thick skin..of you post on here...!

The interior will be fine...
As long as you like it...
.and the cards and seat covers are saleable if you tire...

Dove Blue...

Repaint it all Turkis. ..
See I warned you..


Will be a nice interior..
Need to say how tall you are..or turn seat back around. .
G

...and I think it will go..
Shades of blue...
G

I kinda guessed that, but it's all good fun!

I'm 5.11 so I will swop the seat around if possible.

The interiors not completely original but it's a usable Devon type so I'm happy.

Now all I need to do is finish the bus, so only a couple of years to go before I fit the interior!!

Thanks again Paul
